subject: Re: Using MockitoJUnitRunner.class instead of SpringJUnit4ClassRunner.class
msgSnippet: Ayaskant - as you have said, I too would prefer not to have to rely on an IoC container in my unit tests, whenever possible. There are some cases where it s
messageBody:
Ayaskant -

as you have said, I too would prefer not to have to rely on an IoC container in my unit tests, whenever possible. There are some cases where it's easier to use a container, e.g. when testing JpaRepositories. Strictly speaking, you could argue that such tests should rather be called integration tests.

Hope that helps!

Cheers, Marc
